column1: '''Emily Jane Neave (''n√©e'' Suffield)''' ([[June]] [[1872]] - [[22 February]] [[1963]]<ref>[[Andrew H. Morton]]
column5: and thus one of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s aunts.

column1: Jane Neave worked as a schoolteacher
column2: and the young J.R.R. Tolkien on occasion stayed with his aunt and her husband Edvin Neave while [[Mabel Tolkien]] was hospitalized.<ref>{{CG|RG}}
column3: pp. 637-8</ref>Jane Neave's farm was called Bag End by the locals in Dormston

column1: Because of a suggestion from Jane Neave
column2: J.R.R. Tolkien published the book ''[[The Adventures of Tom Bombadil]]'' in [[1962]].<ref>[[Tom Shippey]]
column4: in ''[[Tales from the Perilous Realm]]'' ([[J.R.R. Tolkien]]; HarperCollins 2008)
